<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
2020
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/04/went-wrong-iowa-caucuses?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Iowa Caucus or Apple Maps?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A ballot being shredded by a smartphone" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwODU2Nzk1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Monday night’s Democratic Iowa caucuses did not go smoothly. Technical glitches left Iowa Democratic Party (IDP) <a href="https://apnews.com/69dd698aed24770b925add5fb69b501f?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">officials and volunteers scrambling</a> to transmit and validate vote totals. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Iowa caucusgoers cast the first votes in the presidential primary races. The winner won’t necessarily be the nominee, but pundits and the general public view Iowa as a test of the candidates’ strength.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What went wrong </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This year, the IDP rolled out a new mobile app for precinct workers to share voting totals with party officials. The idea was to modernize the process; previously, workers had to call their totals in to state party leaders on the phone (ew). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The app did not work—it couldn’t handle the volume of a statewide election. Many workers were forced to call in to a party hotline, which gave them a steaming batch of “Your call will be answered in the order it is received.” </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Who’s to blame </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Obviously, the IDP is taking a lot of heat—they didn’t test the app with precinct organizers and rushed its development. Cybersecurity experts say that was irresponsible. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Iowa Democratic Party Chairman Troy Price said there was a “coding issue” but no hack or intrusion, and no underlying voting data was compromised. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Also under fire is the startup that made the app, Shadow, which was founded by former Hillary Clinton campaigners aiming to upgrade the party’s online operations. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/ShadowIncHQ/status/1224773796307050497?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fd-38833205302844296537.ampproject.net%2F2001251659540%2Fframe.html&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">apologized</a></span><span> for the delay in a Twitter thread yesterday afternoon.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The fallout </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some commentators are questioning the introduction of tech solutions to the democratic process. The NYT’s <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/04/technology/election-tech.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Kevin Roose writes</a>, “every piece of technology involved in the voting process is a possible point of failure. And the larger and more interconnected the technical system, the more vulnerable it is to an attack.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>This is an embarrassing moment for the Iowa Democrats. But when it comes to elections, late is better than inaccurate.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/04/disney-beats-earnings-expectations-disney-big-first-quarter?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Disney+ Only Knows How to Add
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="An illustration of a TV with Disney+ on it " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczNTA5MDM5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Disney reported fiscal Q1 earnings yesterday, its first since launching the Disney+ streaming service in November. First, the high-level financials:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Total revenue was </span><span><a href="https://www.thewaltdisneycompany.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/q1-fy20-earnings.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">up 36%</a></span><span> annually to $20.9 billion.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But Disney+ expenses dragged profit down 23%.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Next, the Baby Yoda stuff</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Disney+ added 10 million subscribers on launch day, and that was before anyone met the most irresistible carnivorous humanoid ever to be animated. Disney+ ended up beating expectations with 26.5 million subscribers at the end of Q1 and 28.6 million as of Monday. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>For context: In 83 days, Disney+’s user base grew from zero to 17% the size of Netflix’s.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s impressive, but don’t forget about its other streaming properties that <a href="https://apnews.com/8e70828b20622e82a1605c897313f3da?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">all fit together</a> in a tidy $13/month bundle. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>ESPN+ grew to 6.6 million subscribers from 1.4 million a year ago.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The number of Hulu subscribers grew 33% annually to 30.4 million. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the company is about to find out whether Disney+ subscribers will stick around for exclusive Marvel content.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/04/macys-will-close-125-stores-cut-2000-corporate-jobs?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Macy’s Problem: Way Too Many Stores
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Macy's store in NYC" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwODU5MDA4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The retailer said it will <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/04/macys-to-close-125-stores-sees-480-million-in-restructuring-costs-to-2000-corporate-jobs.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">close 125 department stores</a> over the next three years—about a fifth of its total locations. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Also going: </strong></span><span>About 2,000 corporate jobs, its Cincinnati HQ, and tech offices in SF. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As is 21st century retail tradition, the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/macy-s-to-close-125-department-stores-exit-weakest-malls-11580850007?mod=hp_lead_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mall takes the fall</a>. Macy’s will leave its locations in the weakest malls and open smaller locations called “Market by Macy’s” in shopping centers near main roads. They’ll be 10% the size of a typical Macy’s.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Macy’s will present its turnaround plan to investors today. Expectations are in the basement near the lost shoppers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>You can read more about Macy's in today's <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=retailbrew&email={email}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Retail Brew</a>.  </em></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F02%2F04%2Fmacys-will-close-125-stores-cut-2000-corporate-jobs" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY THE MOTLEY FOOL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Expert > Not Expert
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/03/stock-trading-expert-told-us-expert-stuff" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="The Motley Fool" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMjcvMTU4MDIzNzA3OS1UZWNoLTM3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6ImNvbWV0LW1vcm5pbmdicmV3IiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You are an expert at many things (please take a moment to think of them all now, and know that we’re proud of you). But, just spitballing here, there’s a good chance you don’t have a 160 IQ on the shifting economics in urban China. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s ok, not everyone can be a self-professed stock savant like our loud friend Erick (yes, with a K). So lately we’ve been turning to our friends at <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/03/stock-trading-expert-told-us-expert-stuff" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Motley Fool</a>, more specifically their Stock Advisor service, to help us navigate the increasingly complicated and, says Erick (with a K), borderless world of investing. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We had a chance to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/03/stock-trading-expert-told-us-expert-stuff" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sit down with one of The Motley Fool’s Analysts</a>, Jason Moser, to learn how he can help us (and you). It was an eye-opening discussion filled with expert analysis that, if we’re being honest, was way easier to digest than one of Erick's (with a K’s) handwritten volatility charts. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/03/stock-trading-expert-told-us-expert-stuff" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check out what Jason had to say here</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if !mso]><! -- -->

<!-- <![endif]-->


<!--[if !mso ]><! -- -->
<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PUBLIC HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/04/effects-coronavirus-hit-multiple-industries?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Ghost Towns and Shutdowns
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A motorcyclist stops for a traffic light in front of the Casino Lisboa on February 4, 2020 in Macau, China" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwODQ4NDAxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Anthony Kwan/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As the number of confirmed coronavirus cases crossed 24,000 yesterday, industries dependent on China began showing new symptoms. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Gambling: </strong>The semiautonomous Chinese territory of Macau—aka the “Las Vegas of Asia” even though it actually does 6x the gaming revenue—<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/04/business/coronavirus-macau-gambling.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closed casinos</a> for two weeks and suspended basic public services. Macau's government earns 80% of its revenue from gambling, and the closure could wipe 5%–15% off the industry's top line in 2020.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Auto:</strong> Hyundai will <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/04/coronavirus-damages-chinas-auto-industry-as-outbreak-worsens.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suspend</a> production in South Korea as components from Chinese suppliers dry up. It's the first major carmaker outside China to shutter factories. IHS Markit predicts automakers will produce 350,000 fewer vehicles than expected this quarter. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Sorta auto: Uber </span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-51358042?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suspended</a></span><span> 240 customer accounts after two drivers in Mexico transported a passenger with coronavirus.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Luxury: </strong>Danish mink breeders <a href="https://apnews.com/957b76882c9ca154f9fb88dd1c0cf56f?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shelved</a> February's auction of 2 million furs. And Italy expects a 1.8% decline in fashion sales in the first half of 2020. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>some experts think the coronavirus has all the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/02/health/coronavirus-pandemic-china.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">warning signs of a pandemic</a>. If they're right, this might just be the first wave of consequences for business.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/04/wendys-launching-breakfast-menu-march?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Wendy Is Now a Morning Person
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A photo fo Wendy's breakfast sandwiches and coffee drinks" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTUxL2FfcGhvdG9fZm9fd2VuZHlfc19icmVha2Zhc3Rfc2FuZHdpY2hlc19hbmRfY29mZmVlX2RyaW5rcy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Wendy's</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When we think of chefs “hand-cracking fresh eggs” we don't typically think of Wendy's. But that may change on March 2 when the fast food chain begins <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/04/wendys-to-launch-breakfast-nationwide-in-march.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">serving breakfast</a> across the U.S.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>With traffic slowing down across the industry, breakfast really is the most important meal of the day for fast food.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“We have to win at breakfast,” McDonald's CEO Chris Kempczinski </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/01/29/business/mcdonalds-earnings/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said last week</a></span><span>. His company got a head start: It debuted all-day breakfast in 2015.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Wendy's anticipates its breakfast menu will ultimately account for 10% of total daily sales.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Wendy's is hoping this rollout goes better than <a href="https://www.qsrmagazine.com/fast-food/wendys-fully-committed-breakfast-time-around?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">past breakfast efforts</a>. A test launched in 2010 didn't meet targets, and the company pulled the plug in 2013. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Now for the audience interaction part</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We're going to rank fast food breakfast items, you're going to tell us how wrong we are. </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Chick-fil-A: </strong></span><span>Chick-n-Minis</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Tim Hortons: </strong></span><span>Hot Breakfast Sandwich</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">McDonald's: </strong></span><span>Sausage, Egg & Cheese Biscuit</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Dunkin': </strong></span><span>Anything on the croissant</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Del Taco: </strong></span><span>Huevos Rancheros Epic Burrito </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Wendy's: </strong></span><span>We haven't tried it yet but the Honey Butter Chicken Biscuit sounds delicious. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Taco Bell: </strong></span><span>Waffle Taco (</span><span><a href="https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/244266?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">RIP</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What's your favorite fast food breakfast? <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/HVKJzX?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Share it here</a>. </p>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last week, in dishonor of Brexit, we asked you to mash up different ways of saying “farewell” to U.S. states. Here are our favorites so far (and they are<span> </span><em>really<span> </span></em>good). Keep ’em coming<span> </span><a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1223278623681105920?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Massadieusetts</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Hasta la Virginia, baby!</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>New York, new me</span></li>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Brew readers are rightly flabbergasted by Tesla stock’s recent performance. Two of them, Mike W. and his friend Wynn, even shared with us a trivia game they started playing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How it works:</strong> We’ll give you a company, you have to say whether its market value is greater than or less than Tesla’s $159.9 billion (as of market close yesterday).  </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>McDonald’s</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ford + GM + Honda</span></li>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Goldman Sachs + Morgan Stanley </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>30 Macy's</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Keep scrolling for the answer. </em></p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Written by
<a href="https://twitter.com/Neal_Freyman" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Neal Freyman</a>, <a href="https://twitter.com/its_ahickey" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Alex Hickey</a>, <a href="https://twitter.com/jamiekaywilde" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Jamie Wilde</a>, and <a href="https://twitter.com/ElizaCarter34" class="link" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Eliza Carter</a>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\n2020\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/04/went-wrong-iowa-caucuses?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nIowa Caucus or Apple Maps?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A ballot being shredded by a smartphone\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwODU2Nzk1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMonday night’s Democratic Iowa caucuses did not go smoothly. Technical glitches left Iowa Democratic Party (IDP) \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/69dd698aed24770b925add5fb69b501f?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eofficials and volunteers scrambling\u003c/a\u003e to transmit and validate vote totals. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eIowa caucusgoers cast the first votes in the presidential primary races. The winner won’t necessarily be the nominee, but pundits and the general public view Iowa as a test of the candidates’ strength.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat went wrong \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis year, the IDP rolled out a new mobile app for precinct workers to share voting totals with party officials. The idea was to modernize the process; previously, workers had to call their totals in to state party leaders on the phone (ew). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe app did not work—it couldn’t handle the volume of a statewide election. Many workers were forced to call in to a party hotline, which gave them a steaming batch of “Your call will be answered in the order it is received.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWho’s to blame \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eObviously, the IDP is taking a lot of heat—they didn’t test the app with precinct organizers and rushed its development. Cybersecurity experts say that was irresponsible. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIowa Democratic Party Chairman Troy Price said there was a “coding issue” but no hack or intrusion, and no underlying voting data was compromised. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAlso under fire is the startup that made the app, Shadow, which was founded by former Hillary Clinton campaigners aiming to upgrade the party’s online operations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIt \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/ShadowIncHQ/status/1224773796307050497?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed\u0026ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fd-38833205302844296537.ampproject.net%2F2001251659540%2Fframe.html\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eapologized\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for the delay in a Twitter thread yesterday afternoon.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe fallout \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome commentators are questioning the introduction of tech solutions to the democratic process. The NYT’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/04/technology/election-tech.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eKevin Roose writes\u003c/a\u003e, “every piece of technology involved in the voting process is a possible point of failure. And the larger and more interconnected the technical system, the more vulnerable it is to an attack.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThis is an embarrassing moment for the Iowa Democrats. But when it comes to elections, late is better than inaccurate.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDisney reported fiscal Q1 earnings yesterday, its first since launching the Disney+ streaming service in November. First, the high-level financials:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTotal revenue was \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.thewaltdisneycompany.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/q1-fy20-earnings.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eup 36%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e annually to $20.9 billion.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut Disney+ expenses dragged profit down 23%.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNext, the Baby Yoda stuff\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDisney+ added 10 million subscribers on launch day, and that was before anyone met the most irresistible carnivorous humanoid ever to be animated. Disney+ ended up beating expectations with 26.5 million subscribers at the end of Q1 and 28.6 million as of Monday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFor context: In 83 days, Disney+’s user base grew from zero to 17% the size of Netflix’s.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat’s impressive, but don’t forget about its other collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs the number of confirmed coronavirus cases crossed 24,000 yesterday, industries dependent on China began showing new symptoms. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGambling: \u003c/strong\u003eThe semiautonomous Chinese territory of Macau—aka the “Las Vegas of Asia” even though it actually does 6x the gaming revenue—\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/04/business/coronavirus-macau-gambling.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclosed casinos\u003c/a\u003e for two weeks and suspended basic public services. Macau's government earns 80% of its revenue from gambling, and the closure could wipe 5%–15% off the industry's top line in 2020.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAuto:\u003c/strong\u003e Hyundai will \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/04/coronavirus-damages-chinas-auto-industry-as-outbreak-worsens.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuspend\u003c/a\u003e production in South Korea as components from Chinese suppliers dry up. It's the first major carmaker outside China to shutter factories. IHS Markit predicts automakers will produce 350,000 fewer vehicles than expected this quarter. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSorta auto: Uber \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-51358042?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuspended\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e 240 customer accounts after two drivers in Mexico transported a passenger with coronavirus.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLuxury: \u003c/strong\u003eDanish mink breeders \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/957b76882c9ca154f9fb88dd1c0cf56f?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshelved\u003c/a\u003e February's auction of 2 million furs. And Italy expects a 1.8% decline in fashion sales in the first half of 2020. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003esome experts think the coronavirus has all the \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/02/health/coronavirus-pandemic-china.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewarning signs of a pandemic\u003c/a\u003e. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen we think of chefs “hand-cracking fresh eggs” we don't typically think of Wendy's. But that may change on March 2 when the fast food chain begins \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/04/wendys-to-launch-breakfast-nationwide-in-march.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eserving breakfast\u003c/a\u003e across the U.S.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eWith traffic slowing down across the industry, breakfast really is the most important meal of the day for fast food.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e“We have to win at breakfast,” McDonald's CEO Chris Kempczinski \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/01/29/business/mcdonalds-earnings/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid last week\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. His company got a head start: It debuted all-day breakfast in 2015.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWendy's anticipates its breakfast menu will ultimately account for 10% of total daily sales.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eWendy's is hoping this rollout goes better than \u003ca href=\"https://www.qsrmagazine.com/fast-food/wendys-fully-committed-breakfast-time-around?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epast breakfast efforts\u003c/a\u003e. A test launched in 2010 didn't meet targets, and the company pulled the plug in 2013. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNow for the audience interaction part\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp
